intro: Corymbium africanum subsp. scabridum, commonly known as the rough corymbium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally rough to the touch, giving it the subspecies name *scabridum*. The flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
